t: Isaiah 43
Israel Redeemed
But*pn now, thus says the Lord,*s your Creator, O Jacob, And*ln He who formed you, O Israel, “Do*ln not fear, for I have redeemed you; I*ln have called you by name; you are Mine!

When*ln you pass through the waters, I will be with you; And*ln through the rivers, they will not overflow you. When*ln you walk through the fire, you will not be scorched, Nor*ln will the flame burn you.
For*ln I am the Lord*s your God, The*ln Holy One of Israel, your Savior; I*ln have given Egypt as your ransom, Cush*ln and Seba in your place.
Since*ln you are precious in My sight, Since*iln you are honored and I love you, I*ln will give other*i men in your place and other*i peoples in exchange for your life.
Do*ln not fear, for I am with you; I*ln will bring your offspring from the east, And*ln gather you from the west.
I*ln will say to the north, ‘Give them*i up!’ And*ln to the south, ‘Do not hold them*i back.’ Bring*ln My sons from afar And*ln My daughters from the ends of the earth,
Everyone*ln who is called by My name, And*ln whom I have created for My glory, Whom*ln I have formed, even whom I have made.”
Israel Is God’s Witness
Bring*pn out the people who are blind, even though they have eyes, And*ln the deaf, even though they have ears.

All*ln the nations have gathered together So*ln that the peoples may be assembled. Who*ln among them can declare this And*ln proclaim to us the former things? Let*ln them present their witnesses that they may be justified, Or*ln let them hear and say, “It is true.”

“You*ln are My witnesses,” declares the Lord,*s “And*ln My servant whom I have chosen, So*ln that you may know and believe Me And*ln understand that I am He. Before*ln Me there was no God formed, And*ln there will be none after Me.
I,*ln even I, am the Lord,*s And*ln there is no savior besides Me.
It*ln is I who have declared and saved and proclaimed, And*ln there was no strange god*i among you; So*ln you are My witnesses,” declares the Lord,*s “And*ln I am God.
Even*ln from eternity I am He, And*ln there is none who can deliver out of My hand; I*ln act and who can reverse it?”
Babylon to Be Destroyed

Thus*p says the Lord*s your Redeemer, the Holy One of Israel, “For*pn your sake I have sent to Babylon, And*ln will bring them all down as fugitives, Even*ln the Chaldeans, into the ships in which they rejoice.
I*ln am the Lord,*s your Holy One, The*ln Creator of Israel, your King.”
Thus*p says the Lord,*s Who*pn makes a way through the sea And*ln a path through the mighty waters,
Who*ln brings forth the chariot and the horse, The*ln army and the mighty man (They*ln will lie down together and*i not rise again; They*ln have been quenched and*i extinguished like a wick):
“Do*ln not call to mind the former things, Or*ln ponder things of the past.
Behold,*ln I will do something new, Now*ln it will spring forth; Will*ln you not be aware of it? I*ln will even make a roadway in the wilderness, Rivers*ln in the desert.
The*ln beasts of the field will glorify Me, The*ln jackals and the ostriches, Because*ln I have given waters in the wilderness And*ln rivers in the desert, To*ln give drink to My chosen people.
The*ln people whom I formed for Myself Will*ln declare My praise.
The Shortcomings of Israel
“Yet*pn you have not called on Me, O Jacob; But*ln you have become weary of Me, O Israel.
You*ln have not brought to Me the sheep of your burnt offerings, Nor*ln have you honored Me with your sacrifices. I*ln have not burdened you with offerings, Nor*ln wearied you with incense.
You*ln have bought Me not sweet cane with money, Nor*ln have you filled Me with the fat of your sacrifices; Rather*ln you have burdened Me with your sins, You*ln have wearied Me with your iniquities.
“I,*ln even I, am the one who wipes out your transgressions for My own sake, And*ln I will not remember your sins.
Put*ln Me in remembrance, let us argue our case together; State*ln your cause,*i that you may be proved right.
Your*ln first forefather sinned, And*ln your spokesmen have transgressed against Me.
So*ln I will pollute the princes of the sanctuary, And*ln I will consign Jacob to the ban and Israel to revilement.
